memories.title: Electron subprocess hangs with claude -p
memories.content: 6+ attempts to spawn Claude as subprocess in Electron. Shell:true, named pipes, direct spawn — all fail.
memories.rule: Do not attempt shell spawning in Electron for Claude. Use API directly or Tauri.

memories.title: better-sqlite3 requires MSVC build tools
memories.content: Node native modules need Visual Studio C++ Build Tools on Windows. 6GB install.
memories.rule: Use JSON storage first, add native deps when toolchain is ready.

memories.title: Brain engine ported in one session — 20 tests passing
memories.content: Ported Synaptica 9-stage hippocampal pipeline to Hello World. All stages working.

memories.title: Cross-session memory verified — moat works
memories.content: Session 2 context contains full state from Session 1 without re-prompting.

memories.title: CLI working end-to-end in first attempt
memories.content: init, status, tasks, start — all working on first build.

memories.title: taskkill crashes Claude Code session
memories.content: Running `taskkill //F //IM <process>.exe` from Bash tool crashes the Claude Code session repeatedly. Also running never-terminating processes like `npx tauri dev` in foreground crashes when output buffer fills. Solutions: (1) Never use taskkill from Claude Code, (2) Use run_in_background for dev servers, (3) Ask user to kill processes manually.

memories.title: Live reactivity wired up in Hello World
memories.content: File watcher (notify crate) + Tauri events + React listeners = live dashboard. MCP writes to .hello-world/ JSON files, Rust detects changes, emits events, frontend auto-refetches. Zero polling.

memories.title: Live reactivity test #2
memories.content: Testing if the file watcher picks up this MCP write and the app updates live.

memories.title: Live reactivity test
memories.content: Testing real-time file watching. If the Dashboard updated without a refresh, live reactivity is working.

memories.title: Approval Queue is fully disconnected from MCP server
memories.content: The ApprovalQueue UI component reads from a Zustand in-memory store (useActivityStore.approvals). This store is never populated from the file system. The MCP tool hw_check_approval writes an activity event to .hello-world/activity.json but does NOT write to any approvals file. The frontend has no Tauri command for reading approvals, no useTauriData hook for approvals, and no file watcher connection to the approval store. The result: the bottom approval bar always shows "No pending approvals" regardless of what Claude requests. Approve/Reject buttons exist in the UI but are functionally dead. Fix requires: (1) MCP server writes pending approvals to .hello-world/approvals.json with status field, (2) new Rust Tauri command get_approvals reads that file, (3) frontend polls it via useTauriData and syncs into Zustand store, (4) Approve/Reject buttons call a set_approval_status Tauri command that writes the resolution back to file so the MCP tool can read it and unblock.
